notes: I like using this paranthetical wit in writing, mostly for humor (see: nerd). I noticed Chuck Palahniuk did it in Choke, too.  Thief!

definition: Said, with a little humor, as if being visited by an angel.  Sly way of complimenting, as if to say someone's presence is heavenly.

notes: instead of beckon call.  Way with Words (10-18-08)

body: born on third base, but thought he hit a triple
notes: said on bill maher by guest about george w. bush

body: bring the shit to shoe level
notes: heard bill maher say it (10-3-08, real time) in reference to the surge

body: by the by; by and by

notes: kerouac in scattered poems
Variation of champ at the bit, recasting it as chomp "to chew noisily" + bit "part of a horse's harness held in its mouth"; horses tend to chew on their bits when impatient at waiting.

body: colder than a well digger's ass.
notes: Tom Waits from Going to California

body: cut the nose off despite the face
notes: heard on day to day
Funny way of saying Thanks a lot
as opposed to how I normally write it, a 'look-see.'  I actually like that better.

body: go see a man about a horse
notes: go to the bathroom
Reminder to be more polite when getting someone's attention by saying, "Hey."

body: inseparable as fingernail and dirt under it
notes: discussed on Way with Words (8-23-08).  Foreign phrases for things that go closely together
discussed on Way with Words (8-23-08).  Foreign phrases for things that go closely together

body: keep the oars in the water
notes: Make sure things are moving forward, progressing

body: like eating soup with a fork

notes: Organizing something to make it coherent.  Used by critic in reference to plot of Lost

When you contradict yourself.  Can also be understood as so windy or crooked (such as a street) that you're liable to get all confused and disoriented that you meet yourself coming back.  Discussed on Way w/Words (10-11-08).

body: nickel and dime it till it's a million bucks

discussed on Way with Words (10-18-08)

body: riding two horses at the same time
notes: Vic said this in meeting.  Means you're attention is split in two directions.

body: she's a slow drink of whiskey
notes: Jeremy from Sports Night, puffing out a metaphor in response to his gf's response to casey calling dana smokey
Statement of agreeance, actually.  Common in New England (Way with Words, "Love Joe Floggers" minicast)

body: Talking to you is like spitting back at rain
the enemy of my enemy is my friend
There but for the grace of God go I
to use the parlance of our times
useless as tits on a boar hog
warms the cockles of my heart

notes: play the scapegoat

body: wet birds don't fly at night
notes: Like a zen koan.  Meaningless phrase meant to expose the inadequecy of language and reason/logic.  The idea of a koan being there's honor and enlightenment in mulling over and reasoning through things that don't have an answer.  Discussed on Way w/Words (10-11-08).

body: where the rubber meets the road
while away <as in while away the hours>

notes: from movie Glory Daze
To poop.
